body:
In whatever program you are using, so for example:

```
with tf.device("/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:sycl:0"):
  tf.add(...)
```

Theoretically, you shouldn't need to add any SYCL-specific code to the core, just device registrations, kernel registrations, etc.  https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/4359.  However, because we're using Eigen to drive SYCL, we probably do require some SYCL code in the core in a small number of places (like op_kernel.h as in this CL).

I'm just trying to reduce the amount of sycl-specific code in the core where possible.

body_text:
In whatever program you are using, so for example:
with tf.device("/job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:sycl:0"):
  tf.add(...)

Theoretically, you shouldn't need to add any SYCL-specific code to the core, just device registrations, kernel registrations, etc.  #4359.  However, because we're using Eigen to drive SYCL, we probably do require some SYCL code in the core in a small number of places (like op_kernel.h as in this CL).
I'm just trying to reduce the amount of sycl-specific code in the core where possible.
